column1: #Text=is in the Red Centre of Australia , west of Alice Springs , 1234 km south of Darwin .
#Text=It extends along the MacDonnell Ranges west of Alice Springs .
#Text=The park is accessible all year round .
#Text=The cooler months , from April to October , are the most pleasant .
#Text=All roads can be impassable for short periods after heavy rain .
#Text=Vehicle access to West MacDonnell National Park from Alice Springs is via Larapinta Drive and Namatjira Drive .
#Text=From the direction of Uluru - Kata Tjuta National Park , the unsealed Red Centre Way ( 4WD recommended ) connects Watarrka National Park ( Kings Canyon ) with West MacDonnell National Park .
#Text=Simpsons Gap is also accessible via a 17-km sealed bicycle track beginning opposite Flynn 's Grave , 7 km from Alice Springs along Larapinta Drive .
#Text=Heading west on Larapinta Drive from Alice Springs , you 'll see signs for the following ( in order ) :
#Text=At this point there 's a turnoff for Bullen Road which loops back towards Alice Springs and passes through Honeymoon gap .
#Text=If you decide not to take that turnoff , a little further on the road splits : Larapinta continues southeast and Namatjira continues northeast .
#Text=They are both sealed roads , which form a fork which is connected on the ends by a dirt road .
#Text=Great for swimming , although beware - it is cold - even in the middle of summer - so watch out for signs of Hypothermia and do n't swim alone .
#Text=Past Glenn Helen is a 4WD track which leads west , then south to meet up with the end of Larapinta .
#Text=A permit is required ; on the 4wd track you 'll find :
#Text=, also known as Tnorala - a massive meteor crater .
#Text=Registered sacred ground , a permit is required to travel the road ( available at Kings Canyon , Hermansburg and Glen Helen ) and overnight camping is not permitted .
#Text=It 's not on the direct road from Alice to Uluru , but on the Merrereni loop road .
#Text=There are 4WD tracks , picnic tables , and walking tracks .
#Text=The dreamtime story told is worth a read ; it 's really an amazing place .
#Text=The next stop down is Hermansburg , which is the far end of the sealed Larapinta Drive .
#Text=The following are the points of interest leading back into town from the end of Larapinta Drive :
#Text=( Western Arrenda name - Ntaria - pronounced " Ndarra")- an aboriginal community , famous for their ladies Choir , pottery , painting , and for being the home of the late Albert Namatjira .
#Text=It 's the site of an old Lutheran mission , with the best Apple Strudel in Central Australia .
#Text=Whats even better is that its now an aboriginal enterprise , providing training and employment for some of the local people .
#Text=- a high clearance 4WD side-track off Larapinta - recommended for expert 4WD 's only due to soft sand and rock driving .
#Text=- short 4WD side-track off Larapinta - Experience tours and a taste of life in an Aboriginal Community .
#Text=- 4WD track which connects Larapinta to the south Stuart Highway ; some ruins and scenic areas .

#Text=The Finke River Track is a really lovely 4WD track which leads south from Hermannsburg - but should definitely only be used by experienced four-wheel drivers , as there 's every hazard you can imagine for a four wheel drive vehicle .
#Text=Hole is the main destination camping site for the Finke River Track .
#Text=The Larapinta Trail ( +61 8 8951 8250 , ) runs for 223 km along the backbone of the West MacDonnell Ranges from Alice Springs to Mt Sonder .

#Text=The grandeur and timeless beauty of the Ranges are the backdrop and setting for the Trail , which is divided into twelve sections , providing you with an opportunity to experience an ancient landscape at your own pace .
#Text=has a camping area with facilities , while Serpentine Chalet and 2-Mile ( both 4WD only destinations ) provide camping sites with no facilities .
#Text=Has a cafe , restaurant , camping and accommodation .
#Text=, Finke Gorge National Park , Watarrka National Park , Lake Lewis , Lake Bennett
